text:
Belvue is a city in Pottawatomie County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 205 people lived there.
History.
Belvue was planned out in 1871. The first post office in Belvue was created in May 1871.
Geography.
Belvue is at (39.216225, -96.178480). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
People.
Belvue is part of the Manhattan, Kansas Metropolitan Statistical Area.
2000 census.
The 2000 census says that there were 228 people, 75 households, and 54 families living in Belvue.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 205 people, 68 households, and 53 families living in Belvue.
